executive_summary: Demand for navigational instruments is driven by their downstream markets. Diversification of downstream buyers helped to partially shield the industry from extreme swings in downstream demand. While the industry showed resilience through COVID-19, revenue still fell at a CAGR of 1.3% through the end of 2024 to reach $125.7 billion, including an expected boost of 3.4% in 2024 alone. Profit shrunk to an expected 6.7% of revenue in 2024, down from 7.1% in 2019.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: TWO LARGE DOWNSTREAM MARKETS WILL SUSTAIN DEMAND THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The US defense industry is a crucial downstream market for navigational instrument manufacturers and has increased rapidly during the period. Navigational instruments are used in a wide range of military equipment, including aircraft, ships, tanks, and missiles. They are also used by military personnel on the ground to navigate and communicate. Increased demand from the defense industry helped to offset further decreases in industry revenue during COVID-19 in 2020 and the economic downturn that followed.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 PROVED TO BE A STRONG ROADBLOCK FOR THE INDUSTRY
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Aside from a few bright spots in downstream demand, namely from the government, demand plummeted for the industry. As the dollar appreciated, exports came to a halt, dropping significantly in 2020 alone, rendering the industry's largest market effectively useless for the year. With mandates from the federal and state governments, any nonessential businesses had to cease production. Because of this, the industry lost demand from several crucial downstream markets.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising Interest Rates Have Restrained Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In early 2022, the Federal Reserve announced that it would be increasing interest rates across the US economy to try and dial in the rampant, persistent inflation. Increasing interest rates have limited the expansion of industry operators, as the cost of financing large projects becomes much more costly.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Revenue Growth Will Be Offset By Several Negative Trends
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The US defense and transportation industries are two crucial downstream markets for the industry. Downstream demand will falter as US defense and transportation funding falls during the period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: INTERNATIONAL TRADE WILL CONTINUE TO BE CRUCIAL TO REVENUE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: After a period of decline, exports will return to growth and play a crucial role in industry revenue during the outlook period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE INFRASTRUCTURE, INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT WILL LIFT DEMAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While funding for transportation is anticipated to decrease during the period, the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act signed into law by President Biden is expected to provide several billion dollars to update and modernize US infrastructure.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCEMENTS WILL ENSURE CONSISTENT DEMAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Revolutions in Global Positioning System (GPS) technology and Artificial Intelligence (AI) will continue to be integrated into the industry's products.
The second Space Race between competing private companies has boosted demand for navigational instruments from the commercial sector.

industry_definition: The Navigational Instrument Manufacturing industry manufactures navigational, measuring and control instruments. Its products include aeronautical instruments, appliance regulators and controls (except switches), laboratory analytical instruments, navigation and guidance systems (except GPS) and physical properties testing equipment.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: high - steady

key_trends: A fragmented industry keeps overall market share low.
Search, detection and navigational instruments boast much more market concentration.
Government spending has propped up demand for the industry.
Rising interest rates will continue to restrain growth.
Demand from the private sector is expected to boost revenue.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Transportation is the industry's largest segment by far, providing manufacturers with a steady source of downstream demand during the economic downturn.
Demand for industry services primarily comes from the US Navy, Airforce, Army and Coast Guard.
Manufacturers supply healthcare providers, laboratories and private research companies.

products_and_services.product_description: Major products under this segment include radar, radio detection and ranging.
These include instruments that measure various variables.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Totalizing Fluid Meter and Counting Devices

products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes alternator and generator testers.

tier_2_suppliers: Plastic Pipe & Parts Manufacturing in the US
Hose & Belt Manufacturing in the US
Glass Product Manufacturing in the US
Electric Power Transmission in the US
tier_1_buyers: Jewelry & Watch Wholesaling in the US
Car & Automobile Manufacturing in the US
Sporting Goods Stores in the US
Laboratory Supply Wholesaling in the US
Electronic Part & Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_buyers: Diagnostic & Medical Laboratories in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: An increase in construction activity typically leads to an increase in demand for navigational instruments.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Over the past five years, imports have increased, rising since 2018.
Supply chain issues tipped the balance of the global markets in 2020.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Import Penetration and Appreciating US Dollar Depressed Exports
international_trade_points.trade_description: Even as the US economy recovered in 2021, export growth didn't return to pre-pandemic levels.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Faltering Global Trade Scene Squashed Exports During COVID-19
international_trade_points.trade_description: Exports are a crucial piece to this industry.

business_locations.location_description: The West accounts for the largest concentration of industry establishments.
The Mid-Atlantic region has the second largest concentration of establishments.
New England houses some of the largest government contractors.

regulations_points.regulation_description: This policy gives the President of the United States the legal authority to control US exports.

regulations_points.regulation_title: DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY (DOE)'S APPLIANCE LABELING SYSTEM 2013
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Department of Energy requires industry operators to submit annual data on energy and water consumption.
This industry contains a large percentage of US defense companies.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is in a mature life cycle stage.
There is a high level of technology change in the industry.
The industry has a high and steady level of globalization.
The competition level is high and increasing.

factors_increased_barrier: The technologically advanced production process acts as a barrier.
factors_decreased_barrier: The capital intensity level is low.
The market concentration level is low.

basis_points.basis_description: The fragmented nature of the industry, with many players focusing on specific products, leads to high competition.
Manufacturers face constant competition from international players.
The industry requires highly skilled and educated employees, leading to higher labor costs.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Market concentration varies based on the product segment.
The presence of government contracts creates higher concentration among a few companies.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Recent Volatility Has Kept Purchases High
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Manufacturers have faced heightened costs during the period due to COVID-19.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Revenue is partly shielded from volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry benefits from federal funding for defense.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Demand from Downstream Markets Faltered as Global Conditions Shifted
volatility_points.volatility_description: The instrument manufacturers faced much volatility from its other downstream markets.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: PRODUCT INNOVATION IS BROUGHT ABOUT THROUGH STEEP R&D EFFORTS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Manufacturers must constantly research and develop new methods.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Manufacturers Look to Automation and AI to Remain Relevant
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Manufacturers are starting to implement more automation to their production process.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by imports?
FAQs.answer: Imports compete with industry products on a cost basis due to their low-wage costs.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Companies are able to specialize in a niche to better serve their specific customers.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Input prices for metals such as steel have fluctuated historically.

FAQs.question: Have you looked into setting up manufacturing facilities in lower-wage regions of the country?
FAQs.answer: Outsourcing manufacturing to low-cost regions greatly reduces wage costs.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology?
FAQs.answer: Automation has greatly enhanced manufacturing capacity and standardization of products.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation?
FAQs.answer: Automation has helped to curb wage costs for manufacturing employees.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations?
FAQs.answer: Participation in industry assistance groups keeps operators aware of industry news.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Companies implement standard operating procedures that must be followed on a daily basis.

FAQs.question: How has input price volatility affected profit?
FAQs.answer: Volatile input prices have constrained profit.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your customers renew their contracts?
FAQs.answer: Due to product specialization, many customers renew their contracts.

FAQs.question: Do you have access to the latest available and most efficient technology?
FAQs.answer: Access to technological developments through research and development is beneficial.

FAQs.question: Are you able to develop export markets?
FAQs.answer: A focus on export markets increases capacity usage and reduces reliance on the domestic market.

FAQs.question: How do you attract and retain qualified staff?
FAQs.answer: Skilled staff members are needed to develop products and operate advanced machinery.

FAQs.question: Do you track the value of construction?
FAQs.answer: Growth in construction activity typically leads to an increase in demand for industry products.

FAQs.question: Have changes in private investments affected your company?
FAQs.answer: Private investment is critical to the development of new technology and products.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor federal funding for defense?
FAQs.answer: An increase in defense spending typically leads to greater industry revenue.
